intro: Gastrocarpha runcinata, commonly known as the narrowleaf gastrocarpa, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Polygonaceae. It is characterized by its upright, herbaceous stems and lanceolate leaves with a smooth, waxy surface. The plant produces small, clustered greenish-white flowers that bloom in late summer. It is native to temperate regions of the Northern Hemisphere and thrives in moist, well-drained soils. Gastrocarpha runcinata is often found in meadows, woodlands, and along stream banks.
